Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a name.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.84)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372033) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372033)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 85 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
